title: What is the most dangerous thing you know? - Quora

response.answer_text: I know a secret that could destroy the entire world as we know it, if it got out and people became aware of it, and acted on it. Read on only if you’re willing to share this knowledge… The secret is that money is created out of thin air, by special people. It’s willed into existence. It’s something of absolute and universal value, produced from absolutely nothing. Thus, it’s magic, strong magic. Money is magic. The people who make it are magicians. They have cast a spell on the world by writing special occult symbols on pieces of paper. By this device, they have come to own and control essentially everything. This would make “create money” the most powerful magical spell ever cast, I suppose. The world isn’t run by politicians, it’s run by money magicians, who can buy and sell the politicians. The money magicians begin by making money out of thin air, as much as they wish. They loan it out, always asking interest in return. By further magical techniques with ledgers, and lately, computers, they then loan out many multiples of whatever amount of money they have, collecting interest on all of it. And then, everybody else in the whole world spends their entire lives working and chasing and attempting to accumulate this money, borrowing enough to be be able to live and do something, someday, hopefully. Some succeed; most don’t. That’s built into the structure of the game. It’s a rigged game. Because the money is lent upon interest, and must be repaid with more money, also borrowed at interest, the debt is mathematically unrepayable, exponentially growing. By manipulating cash flows, credit, and interest rates, those who create and control money can control everything and everyone. They’ve done so, and they’ve used their power to enrich the richest, and impoverish the rest. They apparently believe it’s in their interest to have everyone poorly educated, deep in debt, without resources, and thus forced into servitude of some sort, either military or corporate, or else the gulag. The power of money creation is obviously the greatest power on Earth, when money can buy anything. Being able to create money is an almost Godlike power; imagine having your own printing press. Why, you could take over the world! Hmm… We think of ourselves as being rational today, of not believing in God-Kings or Divine Monarchs. But why, rationally, do we allow a tiny group of people to hold essentially absolute power over everyone else, to very literally own the world and all of its important institutions? Why can these special people create money and loan it out, when nobody else can? What gives them the (Divine?) right? We know that societies are happiest, most stable, and most abundant when wealth inequalities are minimized. Why, then, do we continue to participate in systems that serve to maximize wealth inequalities? There’s no reason that it has to be this way. We fought against a central bank for a hundred years, and then in 1913 we finally got one. We promptly had the crisis that the bank was supposedly there to avert. In the intervening time, our money has lost 97% of its value. We’re mired in enormous debt, and there are no provisions for periodic forgiveness like a Jubilee year, a Biblical tradition oddly forgotten by many otherwise-religious folks. So this debt is forever, a crushing multi-generational burden. Many Americans are suffering in real poverty, while a few individuals and corporations get grotesquely rich. Why are we allowing this? And why did it happen in the first place? The answer is simple and ugly: Because those at the top of the system are not pursuing rational, benevolent, or wise courses of action. They are not representing the interests of the people, nor the environment. Their policies serve simply to enrich and protect those who are able to buy access to politicians. It’s corruption-as-institution. It’s not necessarily that they’re personally evil people, but the effects of the system on the environment and the majority of humans are pretty evil, so it’s an evil system, formally. The situation is ridiculous, just absurd. Money is the most important thing on earth for most people, because most people lack the money to get what they need, let alone what they want. Meanwhile, a select few get to create their own money, and use it to buy anything and everything. I guess it’s just too large for most people to notice. But it’s eaten us all, it’s consuming the planet and everyone on it, and we really need to see why this is happening. Even if you’re enthusiastic about capitalism and competition and free markets, any ideas about a “level playing field” are made meaningless when one group can create money and collect interest, while everyone else must borrow money and pay interest. Obviously, in the long run, the only winners in that situation will be the banker magicians, and in fact that’s what’s happened. I guess they’re counting on people just not noticing, or not being able to do anything about it if they do. So far that’s worked. But maybe not forever… When enough people realize that we’re playing an un-winnable game, a rigged game, that we’ve been played for suckers, we’ll quit playing. When people realize that we’ve been put under a spell, we can break it. When people realize that we can build alternative systems, we’ll do it. And then, the entire world as we know it will end, incrementally or perhaps suddenly replaced by a much better, happier, healthier one. Maybe we can all be money magicians, and allocate the power of money creation to each person individually, rather than a central bank. Why not? And if they could bail out Wall Street with trillions, we can certainly transfer a similar amount to Main Street, for starters… Let’s say every American has a certain amount every year to create and spend, loan, invest, whatever. No central bank, just democratic money creation. If we did that, along with cutting our enormous “defense” budget down to a reasonable size for national defense rather than international domination, we could have a rich, happy, prosperous nation. We can build whatever kind of systems we want, whatever we can believe in and imagine. We can build a better world, and we should. People are so cynical, probably as a defense against so much misery, a defense against being hurt by another crushed hope, but we can make so many things so much better so easily, and we will. It’s time for an evolution; it’s already underway. That’s very dangerous to the “powers that be” but unless they flow with the tide of history, they’ll be swept away. For the rest of us, there’s a whole new world waiting to be built.

I joined this startup where I am working currently on 1st January 2018. I was expecting a bitter cold, it was frosty chilling. So cutting freezing in my airy room that for 2 months I just did too and fro from the office. It was almost mid-Feb and my first salary was yet to be credited. In no case, I should have opted to spend my 75% of the first salary on living. Rent, deposit and even BROKERAGE, I really regret that money spent. Why did I do so? Because there was a group of college FRIENDS coming by and I needed to shift to a flat. Although my salary didn’t allow it, I did so. Why? Because of FRIENDS…  I was a Dota freak (an online multiplayer video game) for the past three years. Whenever I tried removing Dota from my life Youtube helped me get back. I never thought I would stop playing that game. But I did, why? Because of FRIEND. My credential on some of the answers of Dota speaks “Played 7000 hours in less than 3 years”. I was that crazy for that game, I casually played 40–50 hours in 2 weeks. In the college, the counter was 100–150 hours in 2 weeks. But now that counter is zero. Why? Because of FRIEND.  I started writing on Quora out of nowhere. I never thought anyone would read my writing. My writing always had bad comments from my English teacher, neither did I put in efforts to improve it. I accepted the fact that my English is bad and let it be that way. But I started writing on Quora. Why? Because of FRIEND. I many times thought to stop writing on Quora after getting no views and upvotes. But I didn’t because of some FRIENDS told me I write well. Now I am writing this answer on FRIENDS.  My office working hours are flexible but I need to be present there 6 days a week to clock the weekly hours. There is no provision for weekends. But still, I manage to party 4–5 times a week, sometimes even 7 days a week. Why? Because of FRIENDS How is it possible? With FRIENDS They can make you do things you don’t want, things you never thought, things you never planned and even the things you never desire. They are dangerous but at the same time, they are helpful. They are medicine for the wounded heart and vitamin for the hopeful soul. They are the people you can share your secrets with, cry with, laugh with, and have fun with. They don’t try to change or judge you. They accept you the way you are. The hard times reveals the best ones of them. Keep them safely in your life. They are the siblings God never gave us. They are our chosen family. They are Friends…
